short_description: Travel to the enigmatic Democratic People's Republic of Korea and explore its ornate temples, towering monuments, and bustling cities. Be transported back in time to a country that remains shrouded in mystery

weather.title: North Korea has a continental climate with cold, harsh winters and hot, humid summers. It experiences distinct seasonal variations with relatively low precipitation, especially in the winter months

when_to_visit.title: Sightseeing
when_to_visit.time_period: Spring (April to June), Autumn (September to October)
when_to_visit.short_description: Mild temperatures and limited rainfall, making it perfect for sightseeing and natural areas. Spring sees the blossoming of flowers and trees

when_to_visit.title: Summer
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot and humid with higher chances of rainfall

when_to_visit.title: Winter
when_to_visit.short_description: Cold temperatures and snow, which may limit outdoor activities and sightseeing

weather.best_time: The best time to visit North Korea is during the spring months of April to June and the autumn months of September to October when the weather is mild, and you can participate in local festivities and explore the country's landmarks
